pronunciation: COUNTERVAIL, [counter and Latin , to avail or be strong.]

definitions.text:
Countervail
 [counter and Latin , to avail or be strong.] To act against with equal force, or power; to equal; to act with equivalent effect against any thing; to balance; to compensate.The profit will hardly countervail the inconveniences.Although the enemy could not countervail the kings damage. Esther 7:4.COUNTERVAIL,
Equal weight or strength; power or value sufficient to obviate any effect; equal weight or value; compensation; requital.
